definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to whirl about in the wind

sentences.english: They erected a 2-metre-high mud wall on the windward side.
sentences.chinese: 他们在迎风的一边筑起了一堵两米高的土墙。

sentences.english: The village of Zennor lies upon the windward coast of Cornwall.
sentences.chinese: 真纳是康沃尔郡迎风的海岸边上的小渔村。

sentences.english: The captain ordered the crew to square away and sail before the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船长命令水手迎风扬帆，乘风行驶。

sentences.english: Melady of running in the wind .
The peak negative pressures occur on the leading edge of the roof.
sentences.chinese: 局部负压最大值主要出现在迎风挑檐的边缘部分。

sentences.english: The colour flags snuffled against the wind.
sentences.chinese: 彩旗迎风飘摆呼呼作响。

sentences.english: This boat is brand new and the wind plumps up the sails.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船崭新崭新的，船帆迎风鼓起。

sentences.english: The eastern edge of Willow River seem to elongation, and fluttered in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 东面缘河两岸的杨柳似乎也伸长了，迎风招展。

sentences.english: The red flag flaunt in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 红旗迎风招展如何表达？

sentences.english: Unknown run to the outside of the door, take off jacket, brandish aweather .
sentences.chinese: 无名跑到门外，脱下外衣，迎风挥舞。

sentences.english: The Olympic flag, decorated with five rings, flutters at the top of a flagpole.
sentences.chinese: 旗杆上用五环装饰的奥林匹克会旗迎风摆动。

sentences.english: France lies on the windward side of Europ.
sentences.chinese: 法国位于欧洲迎风的一面。

sentences.english: Her topsails and flying kites had a faint glow upon them where the dawn caught them.
sentences.chinese: 上桅帆和迎风飘动的轻帆映着晨曦的微光。

sentences.english: Coreopsis wildflowers bloom on the Texas coastal prairie.
sentences.chinese: 在得克萨斯州的沿岸草原，野波斯菊迎风开放。

sentences.english: If you've ever seen a one-armed man then you've seen me.
sentences.chinese: 你看到过一个独臂的男人迎风挥拳吗？

sentences.english: Red flags over the customs buildings were flying full in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 海关大楼上的红旗迎风飘扬。

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
